intro: Hedyosmum cumbalense, commonly known as the Cumbalense hedyosmum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments at higher altitudes. Hedyosmum cumbalense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance.
